name: Peanut Snaps
description: A delicious Dutch snack, these Peanut Snaps are a crunchy, sweet treat made with butter, brown sugar, golden syrup, flour, chopped peanuts, and a hint of cinnamon. Simple to bake and perfect for a snack.
keywords: Peanut Snaps, Peanut, Peanut Brittle, Peanut Cookie, Dutch, Dutch Snack, Snack, Dessert, Sweet, Crunchy, Baked, Easy, Quick, Homemade, Simple, Brown Sugar, Golden Syrup, Butter, Cinnamon, Flour, Nutty, Treat, Easy Recipe

recipeInstructions.text: In a small pot, over medium heat stir together the brown sugar, golden syrup and butter. Mix until sugar disolves.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt sugar

recipeInstructions.text: Set mix aside to cool for a few minutes. While that happens line your baking tray with baking paper and mix try ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep while mix cools

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all ingredients together. When laying out on the tray, if you want them to be thin then do about 5 blobs each tray, each one about 1 tbsp. Bake for about 10-15m or until mix is bubbling vigorously and has spread.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake

recipeInstructions.text: If you want them to be thicker, lay the whole mix out on the tray and bake for about 20+ minutes, again until bubbling away.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Let it cool completely. It should become crunchy. At this point break into pieces and store.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool

notes: Probably also easily modified with ginger to make ginger snaps. Haven't tried though.
If you're lazy like me and don't measure out the golden syrup, if you don't add enough it won't spread out as much. Ultimately it will still work.
